commitResults.messageTitle: Renamed Duke to Axel
Implemented a greeting and exit message
Added echo feature
Added the feature to add texts to a limited list and display them
Created a new Task class
Implemented the feature for marking and unmarking of whether tasks in the list are done
Created child classes under the parent 'Task' class
Added the feature to track to do, deadline and event tasks
Created two specific exception classes
Added an exception for unrecognised commands
Further tidied the exception classes, and implemented features to handle exceptions. Added a little character to Axel too. Debugged the toDo function.
Removed redundant MarkException and rephrased to InvalidTaskNumberException for better usage and clarity, added the feature of deletion and the use of list instead of an array
Add testing of text UIs
Add the features of storing the data of previous runs and reloading that data on the next run when Axel is booted again
Merge branch 'branch-Level-7'
Update Axel to understand dates and times
Merge branch 'branch-Level-8'
Use the input/output redirection technique to semi-automate the testing of Duke
Extract Ui, Storage, Parser, TaskList and Command classes to make the code more OOP
Move classes into a package
Merge branch 'master' into add-gradle-support
Automate project builds using Gradle
Add JUnit tests
Debug the code further to package the app as a JAR file
Add JavaDoc comments
Tweak the code to comply with a coding standard
Give users a way to find a task by searching for a keyword in the task description
Merge branch 'branch-A-CodingStandard'

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch 'branch-Level-9'
Deconflict issues that arose from the merge
Add a GUI to the chatbot
Add assert statements to validate important assumptions across the codebase
commitResults.messageBody:
Implemented the assert feature in various parts of the code to document and validate key assumptions, improving robustness and making the code easier to maintain. These assertions are used to catch potential logical errors during development and testing.

Parser Class:
* Added assertions to check if the command input is non-null.
* Verified that ToDo descriptions and Deadline commands contain necessary information.

AddCommand Class:
* Ensured the task being added is non-null before proceeding with the execution.

TaskList Class:
* Added bounds-check assertions to verify that the task index is valid when retrieving tasks.

FindCommand Class:
* Added an assertion to verify that the keyword provided for searching tasks is non-null and non-empty.
* Ensured that the list of matching tasks is not null before attempting to print it.

These assertions will help prevent potential issues from propagating through the codebase and are intended to be enabled during testing or debugging by using the -ea flag when running the application.

The use of assertions ensures that key assumptions hold true, leading to better error detection during development. It helps catch invalid states early and improves code quality by making assumptions explicit.

commitResults.messageTitle: Improve code quality
Merge pull request #1 from e1121208/branch-A-Assertions
commitResults.messageBody: Add assert statements to validate important assumptions across the codebase

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch 'branch-A-CodeQuality'
Add a 'help' command for in-app user guidance
commitResults.messageBody:
> Implemented a HelpCommand class that provides a list of available commands and how to use them.
> Updated the Ui class to include a printHelpMessage() method to display the help information.
> Modified the Parser class to handle the "help" command, allowing users to easily access a list of supported commands.

This change improves the usability of the app by providing clear in-app guidance to users.
